wikipedia_page.main: Air Vice-Marshal Colin Weall Coulthard, CB,  AFC and Bar (27 February 1921  – 15 November 2004) was an officer in the Royal Air Force. He served as a fighter pilot and instructor during World War II, and held several command assignments in Europe between 1945 and 1975.

response: * Air Vice-Marshal Colin Coulthard AFC and Bar (1921–2004), senior RAF officer and Air Attaché to Washington
* Colin Coulthard (1921–2004), British officer in the Royal Air Force
*Colin Coulthard, 83, British Royal Air Force officer.Air Vice-Marshal Colin Coulthard
